greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of chi(-q) / chi(-q^10) in powers of q where chi() is a Ramanujan theta function.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).

In general, if m > 1 and g.f. = Product_{k>=1} (1 + x^(m*k))/(1 + x^k), then a(n) ~ (-1)^n * exp(Pi*sqrt((m+2)*n/(6*m))) * (m+2)^(1/4) / (4 * (6*m)^(1/4) * n^(3/4)) if m is even and a(n) ~ (-1)^n * exp(Pi*sqrt((m-1)*n/(6*m))) * (m-1)^(1/4) / (2^(3/2) * (6*m)^(1/4) * n^(3/4)) if m is odd. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Aug 31 2015
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of q^(-3/8) * eta(q) * eta(q^20) / (eta(q^2) * eta(q^10)) in powers of q.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (1280 t)) = f(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t).
mathematica: nmax = 100; CoefficientList[Series[Product[(1 + x^(10*k))/(1 + x^k), {k, 1, nmax}], {x, 0, nmax}], x] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Aug 30 2015 *)
a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ QPochhammer[ x, x^2] QPochhammer[ -x^10, x^10], {x, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, Sep 06 2015 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x + A) * eta(x^20 + A) / (eta(x^2 + A) * eta(x^10 + A)), n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Oct 17 2008
